title: Ladakh reports 208 new Covid cases in last 24 hours

title: Coronavirus Live Updates April 15: Delhi govt likely to impose weekend curfew to counter surge
description: Coronavirus Live Updates April 15, 2021: India is witnessing the second wave of Covid-19 infections with parts of the country reporting record-high new confirmed cases each day. Measures such as lockdowns and night curfews have been put in place in a number of states, including Maharashtra which is the worst affected state by the novel coronavirus. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), India has 14.71 lakh active cases while more than 11 crore doses of Covid-19 vaccines have been administered to date. Stay tuned to Indiatoday.in for LIVE UPDATES on Covid-19.

title: Bangladesh rings in Ramadan, new year festivities with stricter COVID-19 measures
description: DHAKA: Bangladesh on Wednesday began observing an eight-day lockdown, ordering the closure of all offices and international and domestic transport to push back a second wave of coronavirus infections and ease pressure on overwhelmed hospitals and health workers. As of Wednesday, which also marked the start of the Bengali New Year and the first day of Ramadan for Muslims in the South Asian nation of 160 million people, health authorities had recorded 703,170 cases and 9,987 deaths since March last year.

title: Opinion | China-India disengagement at Ladakh: An unfinished agenda
description:
Existing Status of Standoff

The 11th round of India-China corps commanders' meeting has ended with good optics and pleasantly worded PIB release, with no concrete agreement (if any) disseminated so far. 

After disengagement of troops in eastern Ladakh from north and south of Pangong Tso, no disengagement in other areas including Depsang plains, Gogra, Hot Spring, Demchok, and no further de-escalation, was well predicted by most analysts.

title: Covid-19: Medical team reaches Dipling, Ladakh for vaccination | News - Times of India Videos
description: A medical team reached Dipling, one of the most backward and far-flung areas in Ladakh for Covid-19 vaccination. The vaccination team reached Dipling by helicopter. Thanking PM Modi, Ladakh MP Jamyang Tsering Namgyal tweeted, "Medical team reaches Dipling - one of the most backward & far-flung village Ladakh by Helicopter for COVID19 Vaccination drive. I highly appreciate the Covid Warriors of Ladakh."

title: Ladakh Reopens Pangong Tso Lake To Tourists Amid China Standoff, Covid
description: Amid the coronavirus pandemic and ongoing tension along the international border with China that cuts through the region, the Ladakh administration has reopened the famous Pangong Tso Lake for tourists from January 10.The areas reopening for tourism are not located near the flash points between India and China.

description: Leh (Ladakh) [India], January 2 (ANI): With 59 new COVID-19 cases reported in Ladakh, the total caseload in the Union Territory has reached 9,525, the Department of Information and Public Relations informed on Saturday.
